field.name: args
field.descr: user customized droiddoc args. Available variables for substitution:

field.name: compile_multilib
field.descr: control whether this module compiles for 32-bit, 64-bit, or both. Possible values are "32" (compile for 32-bit only), "64" (compile for 64-bit only), "both" (compile for both architectures), or "first" (compile for 64-bit on a 64-bit platform, and 32-bit on a 32-bit platform

field.name: device_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a device, not only for SoC, but also for off-chip peripherals. When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.descr: emit build rules for this module

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the Java module. This is most useful in the arch/multilib variants to remove non-common files filegroup or genrule can be included within this property.

field.name: init_rc
field.descr: init.rc files to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: installable
field.descr: If set to false, don't allow this module(-docs.zip) to be exported. Defaults to true.

field.name: suffix
field.descr: A suffix to add to the artifact file name (before any extension).

field.name: enabled
field.descr: emit build rules for this module

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: Top level directories for includes. TODO(b/128940869): remove it if aidl_interface can depend on framework.aidl

field.name: init_rc
field.descr: init.rc files to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: local_include_dir
field.descr: Relative path for includes. By default assumes AIDL path is relative to current directory. TODO(b/111117220): automatically compute by letting AIDL parse multiple files simultaneously

field.name: notice
field.descr: relative path to a file to include in the list of notices for the device

field.name: owner
field.descr: vendor who owns this module

field.name: product_services_specific
field.descr: whether this module provides services owned by the OS provider to the core platform. When set to true, it is installed into /product_services (or /system/product_services if product_services partition does not exist).

field.name: product_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a software configuration of a product (e.g. country, network operator, etc). When set to true, it is installed into /product (or /system/product if product partition does not exist).

field.name: proprietary
field.descr: whether this is a proprietary vendor module, and should be installed into /vendor

field.name: recovery
field.descr: Whether this module is installed to recovery partition

field.name: required
field.descr: names of other modules to install if this module is installed

field.name: soc_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist).

field.name: vendor
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist). Use `soc_specific` instead for better meaning.

field.name: vendor_available
field.descr: Whether the library can be installed on the vendor image.

field.name: versions
field.descr: Previous API versions that are now frozen. The version that is last in the list is considered as the most recent version.

field.name: vintf_fragments
field.descr: VINTF manifest fragments to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: name
field.descr: The name of the module. Must be unique across all modules.

field.name: srcs
field.descr: Source file of this prebuilt.

field.name: compile_multilib
field.descr: control whether this module compiles for 32-bit, 64-bit, or both. Possible values are "32" (compile for 32-bit only), "64" (compile for 64-bit only), "both" (compile for both architectures), or "first" (compile for 64-bit on a 64-bit platform, and 32-bit on a 32-bit platform

field.name: device_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a device, not only for SoC, but also for off-chip peripherals. When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.name: targets
field.descr: copy the output of this module to the $DIST_DIR when `dist` is specified on the command line and any of these targets are also on the command line, or otherwise built

field.name: dest
field.descr: The name of the output artifact. This defaults to the basename of the output of the module.

field.name: dir
field.descr: The directory within the dist directory to store the artifact. Defaults to the top level directory ("").

field.name: suffix
field.descr: A suffix to add to the artifact file name (before any extension).

field.name: enabled
field.descr: emit build rules for this module

field.name: init_rc
field.descr: init.rc files to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: notice
field.descr: relative path to a file to include in the list of notices for the device

field.name: owner
field.descr: vendor who owns this module

field.name: product_services_specific
field.descr: whether this module provides services owned by the OS provider to the core platform. When set to true, it is installed into /product_services (or /system/product_services if product_services partition does not exist).

field.name: product_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a software configuration of a product (e.g. country, network operator, etc). When set to true, it is installed into /product (or /system/product if product partition does not exist).

field.name: proprietary
field.descr: whether this is a proprietary vendor module, and should be installed into /vendor

field.name: recovery
field.descr: Whether this module is installed to recovery partition

field.name: required
field.descr: names of other modules to install if this module is installed

field.name: soc_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist).

field.name: vendor
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist). Use `soc_specific` instead for better meaning.

field.name: vintf_fragments
field.descr: VINTF manifest fragments to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: name
field.descr: The name of the module. Must be unique across all modules.

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of source files used to compile the C/C++ module. May be .c, .cpp, or .S files. srcs may reference the outputs of other modules that produce source files like genrule or filegroup using the syntax ":module".

field.name: host_supported
field.descr: If set to true, build a variant of the module for the host. Defaults to false.

field.name: device_supported
field.descr: If set to true, build a variant of the module for the device. Defaults to true.

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that will be added to the aidl include paths.

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the Blueprints file that will be added to the aidl include paths.

field.name: generate_traces
field.descr: whether to generate traces (for systrace) for this interface

field.name: export_aidl_headers
field.descr: export headers generated from .aidl sources

field.name: allow_undefined_symbols
field.descr: allow the module to contain undefined symbols. By default, modules cannot contain undefined symbols that are not satisified by their immediate dependencies. Set this flag to true to remove --no-undefined from the linker flags. This flag should only be necessary for compiling low-level libraries like libc.

field.name: asflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for .S compiles

field.name: bootstrap
field.descr: Allows this module to use non-APEX version of libraries. Useful for building binaries that are started before APEXes are activated.

field.name: c_std
field.descr: C standard version to use. Can be a specific version (such as "gnu11"), "experimental" (which will use draft versions like C1x when available), or the empty string (which will use the default).

field.name: cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles.

field.name: clang
field.descr: Deprecated. true is the default, false is invalid.

field.name: clang_asflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for .S compiles when compiling with clang

field.name: clang_cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles when compiling with clang

field.name: compile_multilib
field.descr: control whether this module compiles for 32-bit, 64-bit, or both. Possible values are "32" (compile for 32-bit only), "64" (compile for 64-bit only), "both" (compile for both architectures), or "first" (compile for 64-bit on a 64-bit platform, and 32-bit on a 32-bit platform

field.name: conlyflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C compiles

field.name: cpp_std
field.descr: C++ standard version to use. Can be a specific version (such as "gnu++11"), "experimental" (which will use draft versions like C++1z when available), or the empty string (which will use the default).

field.name: cppflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C++ compiles

field.name: data
field.descr: list of files or filegroup modules that provide data that should be installed alongside the test

field.name: cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles in debug or release builds

field.name: device_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a device, not only for SoC, but also for off-chip peripherals. When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.name: targets
field.descr: copy the output of this module to the $DIST_DIR when `dist` is specified on the command line and any of these targets are also on the command line, or otherwise built

field.name: dest
field.descr: The name of the output artifact. This defaults to the basename of the output of the module.

field.name: dir
field.descr: The directory within the dist directory to store the artifact. Defaults to the top level directory ("").

field.name: suffix
field.descr: A suffix to add to the artifact file name (before any extension).

field.name: double_loadable
field.descr: whether this module is capable of being loaded with other instance (possibly an older version) of the same module in the same process. Currently, a shared library that is a member of VNDK (vndk: {enabled: true}) can be double loaded in a vendor process if the library is also a (direct and indirect) dependency of an LLNDK library. Such libraries must be explicitly marked as `double_loadable: true` by the owner, or the dependency from the LLNDK lib should be cut if the lib is not designed to be double loaded.

field.name: enabled
field.descr: emit build rules for this module

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the C/C++ module. This is most useful in the arch/multilib variants to remove non-common files

field.name: export_generated_headers
field.descr: list of generated headers to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in generated_headers.

field.name: export_header_lib_headers
field.descr: list of header libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in header_libs.

field.name: export_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the Blueprints file that will be added to the include path (using -I) for this module and any module that links against this module. Directories listed in export_include_dirs do not need to be listed in local_include_dirs.

field.name: export_shared_lib_headers
field.descr: list of shared libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in shared_libs.

field.name: export_static_lib_headers
field.descr: list of static libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in static_libs.

field.name: force_symbols_not_weak_list
field.descr: local file name to pass to the linker as -force_symbols_not_weak_list

field.name: force_symbols_weak_list
field.descr: local file name to pass to the linker as -force_symbols_weak_list

field.name: generated_headers
field.descr: list of generated headers to add to the include path. These are the names of genrule modules.

field.name: generated_sources
field.descr: list of generated sources to compile. These are the names of gensrcs or genrule modules.

field.name: gnu_extensions
field.descr: if set to false, use -std=c++* instead of -std=gnu++*

field.name: group_static_libs
field.descr: group static libraries. This can resolve missing symbols issues with interdependencies between static libraries, but it is generally better to order them correctly instead.

field.name: gtest
field.descr: if set, build against the gtest library. Defaults to true.

field.name: symbol_file
field.descr: Path to a symbol file that specifies the symbols to be included in the generated ABI dump file

field.name: exclude_symbol_versions
field.descr: Symbol versions that should be ignored from the symbol file

field.name: exclude_symbol_tags
field.descr: Symbol tags that should be ignored from the symbol file

field.name: header_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should only provide headers for this module.

field.name: host_ldlibs
field.descr: -l arguments to pass to linker for host-provided shared libraries

field.name: include_build_directory
field.descr: Add the directory containing the Android.bp file to the list of include directories. Defaults to true.

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the root of the source tree that will be added to the include path using -I. If possible, don't use this. If adding paths from the current directory use local_include_dirs, if adding paths from other modules use export_include_dirs in that module.

field.name: init_rc
field.descr: init.rc files to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: instruction_set
field.descr: the instruction set architecture to use to compile the C/C++ module.

field.name: isolated
field.descr: if set, use the isolated gtest runner. Defaults to false.

field.name: ldflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for all link steps

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the Blueprints file that will be added to the include path using -I

field.name: logtags
field.descr: *.logtags files, to combine together in order to generate the /system/etc/event-log-tags file

field.name: no_libcrt
field.descr: don't link in libclang_rt.builtins-*.a

field.name: no_libgcc
field.descr: don't link in libgcc.a

field.name: no_named_install_directory
field.descr: Disables the creation of a test-specific directory when used with relative_install_path. Useful if several tests need to be in the same directory, but test_per_src doesn't work.

field.name: nocrt
field.descr: don't link in crt_begin and crt_end. This flag should only be necessary for compiling crt or libc.

field.name: notice
field.descr: relative path to a file to include in the list of notices for the device

field.name: openmp
field.descr: Build and link with OpenMP

field.name: overrides
field.descr: Names of modules to be overridden. Listed modules can only be other shared libraries (in Make or Soong). This does not completely prevent installation of the overridden libraries, but if both binaries would be installed by default (in PRODUCT_PACKAGES) the other library will be removed from PRODUCT_PACKAGES.

field.name: owner
field.descr: vendor who owns this module

field.name: pack_relocations
field.descr: Generate compact dynamic relocation table, default true.

field.name: cflags
field.descr: Additional compiler flags to use when building this module for profiling (either instrumentation or sampling).

field.name: prefix_symbols
field.descr: if set, add an extra objcopy --prefix-symbols= step

field.name: product_services_specific
field.descr: whether this module provides services owned by the OS provider to the core platform. When set to true, it is installed into /product_services (or /system/product_services if product_services partition does not exist).

field.name: product_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a software configuration of a product (e.g. country, network operator, etc). When set to true, it is installed into /product (or /system/product if product partition does not exist).

field.name: proprietary
field.descr: whether this is a proprietary vendor module, and should be installed into /vendor

field.name: export_proto_headers
field.descr: export headers generated from .proto sources

field.name: static
field.descr: Link statically against the protobuf runtime

field.name: type
field.descr: Proto generator type. C++: full or lite. Java: micro, nano, stream, or lite.

field.name: plugin
field.descr: Proto plugin to use as the generator. Must be a cc_binary_host module.

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that will be added to the protoc include paths.

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the bp file that will be added to the protoc include paths.

field.name: canonical_path_from_root
field.descr: whether to identify the proto files from the root of the source tree (the original method in Android, useful for android-specific protos), or relative from where they were specified (useful for external/third party protos). This defaults to true today, but is expected to default to false in the future.

field.name: recovery
field.descr: Whether this module is installed to recovery partition

field.name: recovery_available
field.descr: Make this module available when building for recovery

field.name: relative_install_path
field.descr: install to a subdirectory of the default install path for the module

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that will be added to the llvm-rs-cc include paths

field.name: flags
field.descr: list of flags that will be passed to llvm-rs-cc

field.name: target_api
field.descr: Renderscript API level to target

field.name: require_root
field.descr: Add RootTargetPreparer to auto generated test config. This guarantees the test to run with root permission.

field.name: required
field.descr: names of other modules to install if this module is installed

field.name: rtti
field.descr: pass -frtti instead of -fno-rtti

field.name: runtime_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should be installed with this module. This is similar to 'required' but '.vendor' suffix will be appended to the module names if the shared libraries have vendor variants and this module uses VNDK.

field.name: address
field.descr: main sanitizers

field.name: undefined
field.descr: local sanitizers

field.name: recover
field.descr: value to pass to -fsanitize-recover=

field.name: blacklist
field.descr: value to pass to -fsanitize-blacklist

field.name: sdclang
field.descr: compile module with SDLLVM instead of AOSP LLVM

field.name: sdk_version
field.descr: Minimum sdk version supported when compiling against the ndk

field.name: shared_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should be dynamically linked into this module.

field.name: soc_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist).

field.name: static_executable
field.descr: compile executable with -static

field.name: static_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should be statically linked into this module.

field.name: stem
field.descr: set the name of the output

field.name: stl
field.descr: Select the STL library to use. Possible values are "libc++", "libc++_static", "libstdc++", or "none". Leave blank to select the default.

field.name: symbol_file
field.descr: Relative path to the symbol map. The symbol map provides the list of symbols that are exported for stubs variant of this library.

field.name: versions
field.descr: List versions to generate stubs libs for.

field.name: suffix
field.descr: append to the name of the output

field.name: symbol_ordering_file
field.descr: Local file name to pass to the linker as --symbol-ordering-file

field.name: symlink_preferred_arch
field.descr: if set, install a symlink to the preferred architecture

field.name: symlinks
field.descr: install symlinks to the binary. Symlink names will have the suffix and the binary extension (if any) appended

field.name: system_shared_libs
field.descr: list of system libraries that will be dynamically linked to shared library and executable modules. If unset, generally defaults to libc, libm, and libdl. Set to [] to prevent linking against the defaults.

field.name: shared_libs
field.descr: list of shared libs that only should be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_shared_libs
field.descr: list of shared libs that should not be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_static_libs
field.descr: list of static libs that should not be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_header_libs
field.descr: list of header libs that should not be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should only be used in the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: cflags
field.descr: List of additional cflags that should be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: shared_libs
field.descr: list of shared libs that only should be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_shared_libs
field.descr: list of shared libs that should not be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_static_libs
field.descr: list of static libs that should not be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_header_libs
field.descr: list of header libs that should not be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_runtime_libs
field.descr: list of runtime libs that should not be installed along with the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: version_script
field.descr: version script for this vendor variant

field.name: override_export_include_dirs
field.descr: list of exported include directories, like export_include_dirs, that will be applied to the vendor variant of this library. This will overwrite any other declarations.

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should only be used in the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: cflags
field.descr: List of additional cflags that should be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: test_config
field.descr: the name of the test configuration (for example "AndroidTest.xml") that should be installed with the module.

field.name: test_config_template
field.descr: the name of the test configuration template (for example "AndroidTestTemplate.xml") that should be installed with the module.

field.name: test_options
field.descr: Test options.

field.name: test_per_src
field.descr: Create a separate binary for each source file. Useful when there is global state that can not be torn down and reset between each test suite.

field.name: test_suites
field.descr: list of compatibility suites (for example "cts", "vts") that the module should be installed into.

field.name: tidy
field.descr: whether to run clang-tidy over C-like sources.

field.name: tidy_checks
field.descr: Extra checks to enable or disable in clang-tidy

field.name: tidy_checks_as_errors
field.descr: Checks that should be treated as errors.

field.name: tidy_flags
field.descr: Extra flags to pass to clang-tidy

field.name: unexported_symbols_list
field.descr: local file name to pass to the linker as -unexported_symbols_list

field.name: unique_host_soname
field.descr: rename host libraries to prevent overlap with system installed libraries

field.name: use_clang_lld
field.descr: Use clang lld instead of gnu ld.

field.name: use_version_lib
field.descr: make android::build:GetBuildNumber() available containing the build ID.

field.name: vendor
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist). Use `soc_specific` instead for better meaning.

field.name: vendor_available
field.descr: whether this module should be allowed to be directly depended by other modules with `vendor: true`, `proprietary: true`, or `vendor_available:true`. If set to true, two variants will be built separately, one like normal, and the other limited to the set of libraries and headers that are exposed to /vendor modules. The vendor variant may be used with a different (newer) /system, so it shouldn't have any unversioned runtime dependencies, or make assumptions about the system that may not be true in the future. If set to false, this module becomes inaccessible from /vendor modules. Default value is true when vndk: {enabled: true} or vendor: true. Nothing happens if BOARD_VNDK_VERSION isn't set in the BoardConfig.mk

field.name: version_script
field.descr: local file name to pass to the linker as --version_script

field.name: vintf_fragments
field.descr: VINTF manifest fragments to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: enabled
field.descr: declared as a VNDK or VNDK-SP module. The vendor variant will be installed in /system instead of /vendor partition. `vendor_vailable` must be explicitly set to either true or false together with `vndk: {enabled: true}`.

field.name: support_system_process
field.descr: declared as a VNDK-SP module, which is a subset of VNDK. `vndk: { enabled: true }` must set together. All these modules are allowed to link to VNDK-SP or LL-NDK modules only. Other dependency will cause link-type errors. If `support_system_process` is not set or set to false, the module is VNDK-core and can link to other VNDK-core, VNDK-SP or LL-NDK modules only.

field.name: extends
field.descr: Extending another module

field.name: whole_static_libs
field.descr: list of modules whose object files should be linked into this module in their entirety. For static library modules, all of the .o files from the intermediate directory of the dependency will be linked into this modules .a file. For a shared library, the dependency's .a file will be linked into this module using -Wl,--whole-archive.

field.name: yaccflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for .y and .yy compiles

field.name: name
field.descr: The name of the module. Must be unique across all modules.

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of input files

field.name: compile_multilib
field.descr: control whether this module compiles for 32-bit, 64-bit, or both. Possible values are "32" (compile for 32-bit only), "64" (compile for 64-bit only), "both" (compile for both architectures), or "first" (compile for 64-bit on a 64-bit platform, and 32-bit on a 32-bit platform

field.name: device_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a device, not only for SoC, but also for off-chip peripherals. When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.name: targets
field.descr: copy the output of this module to the $DIST_DIR when `dist` is specified on the command line and any of these targets are also on the command line, or otherwise built

field.name: dest
field.descr: The name of the output artifact. This defaults to the basename of the output of the module.

field.name: dir
field.descr: The directory within the dist directory to store the artifact. Defaults to the top level directory ("").

field.name: suffix
field.descr: A suffix to add to the artifact file name (before any extension).

field.name: enabled
field.descr: emit build rules for this module

field.name: flags
field.descr: Additional flags to pass to the bindings generation script

field.name: includes
field.descr: list of include paths

field.name: init_rc
field.descr: init.rc files to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: notice
field.descr: relative path to a file to include in the list of notices for the device

field.name: owner
field.descr: vendor who owns this module

field.name: pickles
field.descr: list of pickles modules that will be imported

field.name: product_services_specific
field.descr: whether this module provides services owned by the OS provider to the core platform. When set to true, it is installed into /product_services (or /system/product_services if product_services partition does not exist).

field.name: product_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a software configuration of a product (e.g. country, network operator, etc). When set to true, it is installed into /product (or /system/product if product partition does not exist).

field.name: proprietary
field.descr: whether this is a proprietary vendor module, and should be installed into /vendor

field.name: recovery
field.descr: Whether this module is installed to recovery partition

field.name: required

field.name: name
field.descr: The name of the module. Must be unique across all modules.

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of source files used to compile the C/C++ module. May be .c, .cpp, or .S files. srcs may reference the outputs of other modules that produce source files like genrule or filegroup using the syntax ":module".

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that will be added to the aidl include paths.

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the Blueprints file that will be added to the aidl include paths.

field.name: generate_traces
field.descr: whether to generate traces (for systrace) for this interface

field.name: allow_undefined_symbols
field.descr: allow the module to contain undefined symbols. By default, modules cannot contain undefined symbols that are not satisified by their immediate dependencies. Set this flag to true to remove --no-undefined from the linker flags. This flag should only be necessary for compiling low-level libraries like libc.

field.name: asflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for .S compiles

field.name: bootstrap
field.descr: Allows this module to use non-APEX version of libraries. Useful for building binaries that are started before APEXes are activated.

field.name: c_std
field.descr: C standard version to use. Can be a specific version (such as "gnu11"), "experimental" (which will use draft versions like C1x when available), or the empty string (which will use the default).

field.name: cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles.

field.name: clang
field.descr: Deprecated. true is the default, false is invalid.

field.name: clang_asflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for .S compiles when compiling with clang

field.name: clang_cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles when compiling with clang

field.name: compile_multilib
field.descr: control whether this module compiles for 32-bit, 64-bit, or both. Possible values are "32" (compile for 32-bit only), "64" (compile for 64-bit only), "both" (compile for both architectures), or "first" (compile for 64-bit on a 64-bit platform, and 32-bit on a 32-bit platform

field.name: conlyflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C compiles

field.name: cpp_std
field.descr: C++ standard version to use. Can be a specific version (such as "gnu++11"), "experimental" (which will use draft versions like C++1z when available), or the empty string (which will use the default).

field.name: cppflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C++ compiles

field.name: cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles in debug or release builds

field.name: device_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a device, not only for SoC, but also for off-chip peripherals. When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.name: targets
field.descr: copy the output of this module to the $DIST_DIR when `dist` is specified on the command line and any of these targets are also on the command line, or otherwise built

field.name: dest
field.descr: The name of the output artifact. This defaults to the basename of the output of the module.

field.name: dir
field.descr: The directory within the dist directory to store the artifact. Defaults to the top level directory ("").

field.name: suffix
field.descr: A suffix to add to the artifact file name (before any extension).

field.name: double_loadable
field.descr: whether this module is capable of being loaded with other instance (possibly an older version) of the same module in the same process. Currently, a shared library that is a member of VNDK (vndk: {enabled: true}) can be double loaded in a vendor process if the library is also a (direct and indirect) dependency of an LLNDK library. Such libraries must be explicitly marked as `double_loadable: true` by the owner, or the dependency from the LLNDK lib should be cut if the lib is not designed to be double loaded.

field.name: enabled
field.descr: emit build rules for this module

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the C/C++ module. This is most useful in the arch/multilib variants to remove non-common files

field.name: export_generated_headers
field.descr: list of generated headers to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in generated_headers.

field.name: export_header_lib_headers
field.descr: list of header libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in header_libs.

field.name: export_shared_lib_headers
field.descr: list of shared libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in shared_libs.

field.name: export_static_lib_headers
field.descr: list of static libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in static_libs.

field.name: generated_headers
field.descr: list of generated headers to add to the include path. These are the names of genrule modules.

field.name: generated_sources
field.descr: list of generated sources to compile. These are the names of gensrcs or genrule modules.

field.name: gnu_extensions
field.descr: if set to false, use -std=c++* instead of -std=gnu++*

field.name: group_static_libs
field.descr: group static libraries. This can resolve missing symbols issues with interdependencies between static libraries, but it is generally better to order them correctly instead.

field.name: header_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should only provide headers for this module.

field.name: host_ldlibs
field.descr: -l arguments to pass to linker for host-provided shared libraries

field.name: include_build_directory
field.descr: Add the directory containing the Android.bp file to the list of include directories. Defaults to true.

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the root of the source tree that will be added to the include path using -I. If possible, don't use this. If adding paths from the current directory use local_include_dirs, if adding paths from other modules use export_include_dirs in that module.

field.name: init_rc
field.descr: init.rc files to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: instruction_set
field.descr: the instruction set architecture to use to compile the C/C++ module.

field.name: ldflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for all link steps

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the Blueprints file that will be added to the include path using -I

field.name: logtags
field.descr: *.logtags files, to combine together in order to generate the /system/etc/event-log-tags file

field.name: no_libcrt
field.descr: don't link in libclang_rt.builtins-*.a

field.name: no_libgcc
field.descr: don't link in libgcc.a

field.name: nocrt
field.descr: don't link in crt_begin and crt_end. This flag should only be necessary for compiling crt or libc.

field.name: notice
field.descr: relative path to a file to include in the list of notices for the device

field.name: openmp
field.descr: Build and link with OpenMP

field.name: overrides
field.descr: Names of modules to be overridden. Listed modules can only be other binaries (in Make or Soong). This does not completely prevent installation of the overridden binaries, but if both binaries would be installed by default (in PRODUCT_PACKAGES) the other binary will be removed from PRODUCT_PACKAGES.

field.name: owner
field.descr: vendor who owns this module

field.name: pack_relocations
field.descr: Generate compact dynamic relocation table, default true.

field.name: cflags
field.descr: Additional compiler flags to use when building this module for profiling (either instrumentation or sampling).

field.name: prefix_symbols
field.descr: if set, add an extra objcopy --prefix-symbols= step

field.name: product_services_specific
field.descr: whether this module provides services owned by the OS provider to the core platform. When set to true, it is installed into /product_services (or /system/product_services if product_services partition does not exist).

field.name: product_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a software configuration of a product (e.g. country, network operator, etc). When set to true, it is installed into /product (or /system/product if product partition does not exist).

field.name: proprietary
field.descr: whether this is a proprietary vendor module, and should be installed into /vendor

field.name: static
field.descr: Link statically against the protobuf runtime

field.name: type
field.descr: Proto generator type. C++: full or lite. Java: micro, nano, stream, or lite.

field.name: plugin
field.descr: Proto plugin to use as the generator. Must be a cc_binary_host module.

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that will be added to the protoc include paths.

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the bp file that will be added to the protoc include paths.

field.name: canonical_path_from_root
field.descr: whether to identify the proto files from the root of the source tree (the original method in Android, useful for android-specific protos), or relative from where they were specified (useful for external/third party protos). This defaults to true today, but is expected to default to false in the future.

field.name: recovery
field.descr: Whether this module is installed to recovery partition

field.name: recovery_available
field.descr: Make this module available when building for recovery

field.name: relative_install_path
field.descr: install to a subdirectory of the default install path for the module

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that will be added to the llvm-rs-cc include paths

field.name: flags
field.descr: list of flags that will be passed to llvm-rs-cc

field.name: target_api
field.descr: Renderscript API level to target

field.name: required
field.descr: names of other modules to install if this module is installed

field.name: rtti
field.descr: pass -frtti instead of -fno-rtti

field.name: runtime_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should be installed with this module. This is similar to 'required' but '.vendor' suffix will be appended to the module names if the shared libraries have vendor variants and this module uses VNDK.

field.name: address
field.descr: main sanitizers

field.name: undefined
field.descr: local sanitizers

field.name: recover
field.descr: value to pass to -fsanitize-recover=

field.name: blacklist
field.descr: value to pass to -fsanitize-blacklist

field.name: sdclang
field.descr: compile module with SDLLVM instead of AOSP LLVM

field.name: sdk_version
field.descr: Minimum sdk version supported when compiling against the ndk

field.name: shared_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should be dynamically linked into this module.

field.name: soc_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist).

field.name: static_executable
field.descr: compile executable with -static

field.name: static_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should be statically linked into this module.

field.name: stem
field.descr: set the name of the output

field.name: stl
field.descr: Select the STL library to use. Possible values are "libc++", "libc++_static", "libstdc++", or "none". Leave blank to select the default.

field.name: suffix
field.descr: append to the name of the output

field.name: symbol_ordering_file
field.descr: Local file name to pass to the linker as --symbol-ordering-file

field.name: symlink_preferred_arch
field.descr: if set, install a symlink to the preferred architecture

field.name: symlinks
field.descr: install symlinks to the binary. Symlink names will have the suffix and the binary extension (if any) appended

field.name: system_shared_libs
field.descr: list of system libraries that will be dynamically linked to shared library and executable modules. If unset, generally defaults to libc, libm, and libdl. Set to [] to prevent linking against the defaults.

field.name: shared_libs
field.descr: list of shared libs that only should be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_shared_libs
field.descr: list of shared libs that should not be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_static_libs
field.descr: list of static libs that should not be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_header_libs
field.descr: list of header libs that should not be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should only be used in the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: cflags
field.descr: List of additional cflags that should be used to build the recovery variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: shared_libs

field.name: exclude_shared_libs

field.name: exclude_static_libs
field.descr: list of static libs that should not be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_header_libs
field.descr: list of header libs that should not be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_runtime_libs
field.descr: list of runtime libs that should not be installed along with the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: version_script
field.descr: version script for this vendor variant

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should only be used in the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: cflags
field.descr: List of additional cflags that should be used to build the vendor variant of the C/C++ module.

field.name: tidy
field.descr: whether to run clang-tidy over C-like sources.

field.name: tidy_checks
field.descr: Extra checks to enable or disable in clang-tidy

field.name: tidy_checks_as_errors
field.descr: Checks that should be treated as errors.

field.name: tidy_flags
field.descr: Extra flags to pass to clang-tidy

field.name: use_clang_lld
field.descr: Use clang lld instead of gnu ld.

field.name: use_version_lib
field.descr: make android::build:GetBuildNumber() available containing the build ID.

field.name: vendor
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist). Use `soc_specific` instead for better meaning.

field.name: vendor_available
field.descr: whether this module should be allowed to be directly depended by other modules with `vendor: true`, `proprietary: true`, or `vendor_available:true`. If set to true, two variants will be built separately, one like normal, and the other limited to the set of libraries and headers that are exposed to /vendor modules. The vendor variant may be used with a different (newer) /system, so it shouldn't have any unversioned runtime dependencies, or make assumptions about the system that may not be true in the future. If set to false, this module becomes inaccessible from /vendor modules. Default value is true when vndk: {enabled: true} or vendor: true. Nothing happens if BOARD_VNDK_VERSION isn't set in the BoardConfig.mk

field.name: version_script
field.descr: local file name to pass to the linker as --version_script

field.name: vintf_fragments
field.descr: VINTF manifest fragments to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: enabled
field.descr: declared as a VNDK or VNDK-SP module. The vendor variant will be installed in /system instead of /vendor partition. `vendor_vailable` must be explicitly set to either true or false together with `vndk: {enabled: true}`.

field.name: support_system_process
field.descr: declared as a VNDK-SP module, which is a subset of VNDK. `vndk: { enabled: true }` must set together. All these modules are allowed to link to VNDK-SP or LL-NDK modules only. Other dependency will cause link-type errors. If `support_system_process` is not set or set to false, the module is VNDK-core and can link to other VNDK-core, VNDK-SP or LL-NDK modules only.

field.name: extends
field.descr: Extending another module

field.name: whole_static_libs
field.descr: list of modules whose object files should be linked into this module in their entirety. For static library modules, all of the .o files from the intermediate directory of the dependency will be linked into this modules .a file. For a shared library, the dependency's .a file will be linked into this module using -Wl,--whole-archive.

field.name: yaccflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for .y and .yy compiles

field.name: name
field.descr: The name of the module. Must be unique across all modules.

field.name: compile_multilib
field.descr: control whether this module compiles for 32-bit, 64-bit, or both. Possible values are "32" (compile for 32-bit only), "64" (compile for 64-bit only), "both" (compile for both architectures), or "first" (compile for 64-bit on a 64-bit platform, and 32-bit on a 32-bit platform

field.name: device_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a device, not only for SoC, but also for off-chip peripherals. When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.name: dest
field.descr: The name of the output artifact. This defaults to the basename of the output of the module.

field.descr: The directory within the dist directory to store the artifact. Defaults to the top level directory ("").

field.descr: A suffix to add to the artifact file name (before any extension).

field.name: product_services_specific
field.descr: whether this module provides services owned by the OS provider to the core platform. When set to true, it is installed into /product_services (or /system/product_services if product_services partition does not exist).

field.name: product_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a software configuration of a product (e.g. country, network operator, etc). When set to true, it is installed into /product (or /system/product if product partition does not exist).

field.descr: list of optional source files that are part of API but not part of runtime library.

field.descr: If set to true, compile dex regardless of installable. Defaults to false.

field.name: core_lib

When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.name: enabled
field.descr: If false, prevent dexpreopting and stripping the dex file from the final jar. Defaults to true.

field.name: no_stripping
field.descr: If true, never strip the dex files from the final jar when dexpreopting. Defaults to false.

field.name: app_image

field.name: profile_guided
field.descr: If true, use a checked-in profile to guide optimization. Defaults to false unless a matching profile is set or a profile is found in PRODUCT_DEX_PREOPT_PROFILE_DIR that matches the name of this module, in which case it is defaulted to true.

field.name: profile
field.descr: If set, provides the path to profile relative to the Android.bp file. If not set, defaults to searching for a file that matches the name of this module in the default profile location set by PRODUCT_DEX_PREOPT_PROFILE_DIR, or empty if not found.

field.descr: additional droiddoc options Available variables for substitution:

field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for dex compiles

field.descr: emit build rules for this module

field.name: javacflags
field.descr: List of javac flags that should only be used when running errorprone.

field.name: exclude_java_resource_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that should be excluded from java_resource_dirs

field.name: exclude_java_resources
field.descr: list of files that should be excluded from java_resources and java_resource_dirs

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the Java module. This is most useful in the arch/multilib variants to remove non-common files

field.name: hidden_api_packages
field.descr: list of package names that must be hidden from the API

field.name: hostdex
field.descr: If true, export a copy of the module as a -hostdex module for host testing.

field.name: include_srcs
field.descr: If set to true, include sources used to compile the module in to the final jar

field.name: init_rc
field.descr: init.rc files to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: installable
field.descr: If set to true, allow this module to be dexed and installed on devices. Has no effect on host modules, which are always considered installable.

field.name: include_filter
field.descr: List of classes to include for instrumentation with jacoco to collect coverage information at runtime when building with coverage enabled. If unset defaults to all classes. Supports '*' as the last character of an entry in the list as a wildcard match. If preceded by '.' it matches all classes in the package and subpackages, otherwise it matches classes in the package that have the class name as a prefix.

field.name: exclude_filter
field.descr: List of classes to exclude from instrumentation with jacoco to collect coverage information at runtime when building with coverage enabled. Overrides classes selected by the include_filter property. Supports '*' as the last character of an entry in the list as a wildcard match. If preceded by '.' it matches all classes in the package and subpackages, otherwise it matches classes in the package that have the class name as a prefix.

field.name: jarjar_rules
field.descr: if not blank, run jarjar using the specified rules file

field.name: java_resource_dirs
field.descr: list of directories containing Java resources

field.name: java_resources
field.descr: list of files to use as Java resources

field.name: java_version
field.descr: If not blank, set the java version passed to javac as -source and -target

field.name: javac_shard_size
field.descr: The number of Java source entries each Javac instance can process

field.name: javacflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for javac compiles

field.name: kotlincflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for kotlinc compiles

field.name: libs
field.descr: list of of java libraries that will be in the classpath

field.name: manifest
field.descr: manifest file to be included in resulting jar

field.name: merge_annotations_dirs
field.descr: a list of top-level directories containing files to merge qualifier annotations (i.e. those intended to be included in the stubs written) from.

field.name: merge_inclusion_annotations_dirs
field.descr: a list of top-level directories containing Java stub files to merge show/hide annotations from.

field.name: min_sdk_version
field.descr: if not blank, set the minimum version of the sdk that the compiled artifacts will run against. Defaults to sdk_version if not set.

field.name: no_framework_libs
field.descr: don't build against the framework libraries (ext, and framework for device targets)

field.name: no_standard_libs
field.descr: don't build against the default libraries (bootclasspath, ext, and framework for device targets)

field.name: notice
field.descr: relative path to a file to include in the list of notices for the device

field.name: enabledByDefault

field.name: shrink
field.descr: If true, optimize for size by removing unused code. Defaults to true for apps, false for libraries and tests.

field.name: optimize

field.name: obfuscate
field.descr: If true, obfuscate bytecode. Defaults to false.

field.name: no_aapt_flags

field.name: proguard_flags_files
field.descr: Specifies the locations of files containing proguard flags.

field.descr: vendor who owns this module

field.name: patch_module
field.descr: When compiling language level 9+ .java code in packages that are part of a system module, patch_module names the module that your sources and dependencies should be patched into. The Android runtime currently doesn't implement the JEP 261 module system so this option is only supported at compile time. It should only be needed to compile tests in packages that exist in libcore and which are inconvenient to move elsewhere.

field.name: permitted_packages

field.descr: whether to use `main` when starting the executable. The default is true, when set to false it will act much like the normal `python` executable, but with the sources and libraries automatically included in the PYTHONPATH.

field.descr: true, if the Python module is used internally, eg, Python std libs.

field.name: libs
field.descr: list of the Python libraries compatible both with Python2 and Python3.

field.name: main
field.descr: the name of the source file that is the main entry point of the program. this file must also be listed in srcs. If left unspecified, module name is used instead. If name doesnt match any filename in srcs, main must be specified.

field.name: notice
field.descr: relative path to a file to include in the list of notices for the device

field.name: owner
field.descr: vendor who owns this module

field.name: pkg_path
field.descr: the package path prefix within the output artifact at which to place the source/data files of the current module. eg. Pkg_path = "a/b/c"; Other packages can reference this module by using (from a.b.c import ...) statement. if left unspecified, all the source/data files path is unchanged within zip file.

field.name: product_services_specific
field.descr: whether this module provides services owned by the OS provider to the core platform. When set to true, it is installed into /product_services (or /system/product_services if product_services partition does not exist).

field.name: product_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a software configuration of a product (e.g. country, network operator, etc). When set to true, it is installed into /product (or /system/product if product partition does not exist).

field.name: proprietary
field.descr: whether this is a proprietary vendor module, and should be installed into /vendor

field.name: type
field.descr: Proto generator type. C++: full or lite. Java: micro, nano, stream, or lite.

field.name: plugin
field.descr: Proto plugin to use as the generator. Must be a cc_binary_host module.

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that will be added to the protoc include paths.

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the bp file that will be added to the protoc include paths.

field.name: canonical_path_from_root
field.descr: whether to identify the proto files from the root of the source tree (the original method in Android, useful for android-specific protos), or relative from where they were specified (useful for external/third party protos). This defaults to true today, but is expected to default to false in the future.

field.name: recovery
field.descr: Whether this module is installed to recovery partition

field.name: required

field.name: soc_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist).

field.name: stem
field.descr: set the name of the output binary.

field.name: suffix
field.descr: append to the name of the output binary.

field.name: test_config
field.descr: the name of the test configuration (for example "AndroidTest.xml") that should be installed with the module.

field.name: test_config_template
field.descr: the name of the test configuration template (for example "AndroidTestTemplate.xml") that should be installed with the module.

field.name: test_suites
field.descr: list of compatibility suites (for example "cts", "vts") that the module should be installed into.

field.name: vendor
field.descr: whether this module is specific to an SoC (System-On-a-Chip). When set to true, it is installed into /vendor (or /system/vendor if vendor partition does not exist). Use `soc_specific` instead for better meaning.

field.name: py2

field.name: py3
field.descr: all the "srcs" or Python dependencies that are to be used only for Python3.

field.name: vintf_fragments
field.descr: VINTF manifest fragments to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: name
field.descr: The name of the module. Must be unique across all modules.

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of source (.py) files compatible both with Python2 and Python3 used to compile the Python module. srcs may reference the outputs of other modules that produce source files like genrule or filegroup using the syntax ":module". Srcs has to be non-empty.

field.name: autorun
field.descr: whether to use `main` when starting the executable. The default is true, when set to false it will act much like the normal `python` executable, but with the sources and libraries automatically included in the PYTHONPATH.

field.name: compile_multilib
field.descr: control whether this module compiles for 32-bit, 64-bit, or both. Possible values are "32" (compile for 32-bit only), "64" (compile for 64-bit only), "both" (compile for both architectures), or "first" (compile for 64-bit on a 64-bit platform, and 32-bit on a 32-bit platform

field.name: data
field.descr: list of files or filegroup modules that provide data that should be installed alongside the test. the file extension can be arbitrary except for (.py).

field.name: device_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a device, not only for SoC, but also for off-chip peripherals. When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.name: targets

field.name: dest
field.descr: The name of the output artifact. This defaults to the basename of the output of the module.

field.name: dir
field.descr: The directory within the dist directory to store the artifact. Defaults to the top level directory ("").

field.name: suffix
field.descr: A suffix to add to the artifact file name (before any extension).

field.name: srcs
field.descr: list of source files used to compile the C/C++ module. May be .c, .cpp, or .S files. srcs may reference the outputs of other modules that produce source files like genrule or filegroup using the syntax ":module".

field.name: host_supported
field.descr: If set to true, build a variant of the module for the host. Defaults to false.

field.name: device_supported
field.descr: If set to true, build a variant of the module for the device. Defaults to true.

field.name: export_aidl_headers
field.descr: export headers generated from .aidl sources

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories that will be added to the aidl include paths.

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the Blueprints file that will be added to the aidl include paths.

field.name: generate_traces
field.descr: whether to generate traces (for systrace) for this interface

field.name: allow_undefined_symbols
field.descr: allow the module to contain undefined symbols. By default, modules cannot contain undefined symbols that are not satisified by their immediate dependencies. Set this flag to true to remove --no-undefined from the linker flags. This flag should only be necessary for compiling low-level libraries like libc.

field.name: asflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for .S compiles

field.name: bootstrap
field.descr: Allows this module to use non-APEX version of libraries. Useful for building binaries that are started before APEXes are activated.

field.name: c_std
field.descr: C standard version to use. Can be a specific version (such as "gnu11"), "experimental" (which will use draft versions like C1x when available), or the empty string (which will use the default).

field.name: cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles.

field.name: clang
field.descr: Deprecated. true is the default, false is invalid.

field.name: clang_asflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for .S compiles when compiling with clang

field.name: clang_cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles when compiling with clang

field.name: compile_multilib
field.descr: control whether this module compiles for 32-bit, 64-bit, or both. Possible values are "32" (compile for 32-bit only), "64" (compile for 64-bit only), "both" (compile for both architectures), or "first" (compile for 64-bit on a 64-bit platform, and 32-bit on a 32-bit platform

field.name: conlyflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C compiles

field.name: cpp_std
field.descr: C++ standard version to use. Can be a specific version (such as "gnu++11"), "experimental" (which will use draft versions like C++1z when available), or the empty string (which will use the default).

field.name: cppflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C++ compiles

field.name: cflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for C and C++ compiles in debug or release builds

field.name: device_specific
field.descr: whether this module is specific to a device, not only for SoC, but also for off-chip peripherals. When set to true, it is installed into /odm (or /vendor/odm if odm partition does not exist, or /system/vendor/odm if both odm and vendor partitions do not exist). This implies `soc_specific:true`.

field.name: targets
field.descr: copy the output of this module to the $DIST_DIR when `dist` is specified on the command line and any of these targets are also on the command line, or otherwise built

field.name: dest
field.descr: The name of the output artifact. This defaults to the basename of the output of the module.

field.name: dir
field.descr: The directory within the dist directory to store the artifact. Defaults to the top level directory ("").

field.name: suffix
field.descr: A suffix to add to the artifact file name (before any extension).

field.name: double_loadable
field.descr: whether this module is capable of being loaded with other instance (possibly an older version) of the same module in the same process. Currently, a shared library that is a member of VNDK (vndk: {enabled: true}) can be double loaded in a vendor process if the library is also a (direct and indirect) dependency of an LLNDK library. Such libraries must be explicitly marked as `double_loadable: true` by the owner, or the dependency from the LLNDK lib should be cut if the lib is not designed to be double loaded.

field.name: enabled
field.descr: emit build rules for this module

field.name: exclude_srcs
field.descr: list of source files that should not be used to build the C/C++ module. This is most useful in the arch/multilib variants to remove non-common files

field.name: export_generated_headers
field.descr: list of generated headers to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in generated_headers.

field.name: export_header_lib_headers
field.descr: list of header libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in header_libs.

field.name: export_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the Blueprints file that will be added to the include path (using -I) for this module and any module that links against this module. Directories listed in export_include_dirs do not need to be listed in local_include_dirs.

field.name: export_shared_lib_headers
field.descr: list of shared libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in shared_libs.

field.name: export_static_lib_headers
field.descr: list of static libraries to re-export include directories from. Entries must be present in static_libs.

field.name: force_symbols_not_weak_list
field.descr: local file name to pass to the linker as -force_symbols_not_weak_list

field.name: force_symbols_weak_list
field.descr: local file name to pass to the linker as -force_symbols_weak_list

field.name: generated_headers
field.descr: list of generated headers to add to the include path. These are the names of genrule modules.

field.name: generated_sources
field.descr: list of generated sources to compile. These are the names of gensrcs or genrule modules.

field.name: gnu_extensions
field.descr: if set to false, use -std=c++* instead of -std=gnu++*

field.name: group_static_libs
field.descr: group static libraries. This can resolve missing symbols issues with interdependencies between static libraries, but it is generally better to order them correctly instead.

field.name: symbol_file
field.descr: Path to a symbol file that specifies the symbols to be included in the generated ABI dump file

field.name: exclude_symbol_versions
field.descr: Symbol versions that should be ignored from the symbol file

field.name: exclude_symbol_tags
field.descr: Symbol tags that should be ignored from the symbol file

field.name: header_libs
field.descr: list of modules that should only provide headers for this module.

field.name: host_ldlibs
field.descr: -l arguments to pass to linker for host-provided shared libraries

field.name: include_build_directory
field.descr: Add the directory containing the Android.bp file to the list of include directories. Defaults to true.

field.name: include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the root of the source tree that will be added to the include path using -I. If possible, don't use this. If adding paths from the current directory use local_include_dirs, if adding paths from other modules use export_include_dirs in that module.

field.name: init_rc
field.descr: init.rc files to be installed if this module is installed

field.name: instruction_set
field.descr: the instruction set architecture to use to compile the C/C++ module.

field.name: ldflags
field.descr: list of module-specific flags that will be used for all link steps

field.name: local_include_dirs
field.descr: list of directories relative to the Blueprints file that will be added to the include path using -I

field.name: logtags
field.descr: *.logtags files, to combine together in order to generate the /system/etc/event-log-tags file

field.name: no_libcrt
field.descr: don't link in libclang_rt.builtins-*.a

field.name: no_libgcc
field.descr: don't link in libgcc.a

field.name: nocrt
field.descr: don't link in crt_begin and crt_end. This flag should only be necessary for compiling crt or libc.

field.name: notice

field.name: overrides

This does not completely prevent installation of the overridden libraries, but if both binaries would be installed by default (in PRODUCT_PACKAGES) the other library will be removed from PRODUCT_PACKAGES.

This defaults to true today, but is expected to default to false in the future.
